text: Recientemnte fui a comer a sin fronteras tacos woow la comida estaba muy rica ordene un brurrito mojado. El lugar muy limpio y muy buen servicio.quede muy satisfecho con el servicio
I've never been to the actual place but I've ordered delivery 3x times already and so far it is good. We tried the carnitas tacos, chicken quesadilla, asada fries, chimichanga and churros.
Amaaaaazing tacos! I got the carnitas, asada, and chorizo!! Server was super nice and very informative! Will definitely come back!!

Another great new restaurant on the northwest side of town. We came looking for great tacos al pastor, and they were great. But we fell in love with all the other selections. The chicken tinga was moist and flavorful. The carne asada was fantastic, and the carnitas tacos were the best I've had in the Vegas valley. Plus, the service was friendly and attentive. We will go back often and recommend it to our friends.

Bomb. Really great Mexican food at a great price. The owner is super nice and his idea of bringing this kind of food to this area is PERFECT! Will be coming here again for sure! Tacos al pastor and Assad fries were amazing.

Hoooooooooooo man! The chimichanga my dude! So good. And they got Sopes. Tortilla was a little hard on the sope but still delicious.  Fresh Guac!!! Get it! Best Mexican in the south IMO. I am still on the hunt for the best. But so far this one is it.
Awesome place, friendly staff, great al pastor and salsas.  Everything we had was great...CHEESE SAUCE!!!
Street tacos were delicious. Atmosphere was humble but clean. Service was great and price was reasonable. Got more than I paid for.
This place is awesome! The carne asada nachos/fries are amazing! The hot sauce is very hot so be careful, but it is very flavorful. Can't wait to go again!

Got the 3 taco plate it was so good. El Pastor tacos rice and beans. The El Pastor was really tasty and fresh. Not dry or over cooked like some other taco places. Really good flavor and sauce. Not super spicy thankfully. Rice and beans were good too. The staff was really nice. I would go back.

This place was great. The restaurant that was there before was horrible, horrible food, horrible all around......Sin Fronteras, WOW!!! Great food, was great price and the service was amazing. For a restaurant just starting out, i was suprised to see that they serve your food with real silverware, plates are glass or ceramic and your drinks are the same too unless you take your food to go. Most places is Styrofoam, plastic, et cetera. 
I don't know of any other small restaurant that treats you like family when you are there. We will be going back for sure. I suggest that anyone who loves mexican food as much as my family does to try them out. You will not regret your decision. By the way the deliver too......

Came here expecting a let down not gonna lie. To my surprise food was sooo good! Lots of flavor in the carne Assad chimi I got. The carne Assad fries were filled with flavor as well. Staff was really friendly and lots of choices for drinks.
Best tacos in Las Vegas hands down! Close to my house and their sauces are really good. I had marinated pork tacos which were boy of amazing! Horchata of course

This was a great dinner experience...I had the street tacos and they were excellent.  I stopped off on a whim and glad I did.  I will definitely be eating here again soon!  The counter service was efficient and quick.  The facility was clean and well maintained...always a good indication of the quality of food.  They pay attention to those details and you're sure that attention will extend to your plate, as well!  I highly recommend this establishment for a quality meal and good service.

Ordered online, was ready in 15 minutes. Went to pick it up and the guy working already had it ready in hand when we walked in. The food was delicious and made correctly! We got the carne asada friends and a chimichanga, both were so yummy! We will deff order from them again.

After ordering from one Mexican restaurant and being told I have to pick up my order that was placed for delivery lol So i ended up placing an order with Sin Fronteras Tacos which I should have done from the start. Not only was the food delicious but the customer service was amazing! Thank u Sin Fronteras Tacos for saving the day!
Brought my 2 girls after school for some quick carne Asada tacos. The place is very clean and  the staff is super nice and welcoming. The food was great :) we will definitely be coming back!

This place has the best Carne Asada fries I've ever had. Their free smokey habanero sauce is so good too! This place is so good. I tried this place because my friend doesn't like Robertos and this place is FAR superior. So good, great horchata, great food, and good prices. 10/10 would recommend.
This is probably the best taco shop on this side of town.  Very good, super meaty tacos. My preference is I would of liked more onions and cilantro with so much meat but I'm not complaining.

If I could give it 10 stars I would! What is there to say? This place is great. Delicious food, great service, reasonably priced! I work across the street and cannot always leave to pick up food. (2-3 times a week) they delivery with no questions ask! 
Keep up the great work you guys! Thank you!!!

The best authentic Mexican in town. Reasonably priced and friendly people. If your in the area the enchiladas are a must try. I have yet to find anyone that prepares them like they do. Simply delicious! They have fast become my favorite lunch stop.
absolutely fantastic and super friendly! homemade truly spicy sauces and salsas. great food. this is my new favorite taco place east of california.

I had some of the best Taquitos I've ever had here.  This place is under new ownership for little while now and I have to say the food here is really good.  If you live in the Centennial area you need to know this restaurant.

We are always on the look out for a great Mexican spot for basic quick food in the NW. We came here a couple times based on the rave Yelp reviews, but sadly this didn't live up to simple expectations. 

The first time, I ordered the taco combo with hard shells and asada. And that's just what I got. A hard shell and meat. That's it! No lettuce, pico, cheese...nothing. These looked pathetic and nothing like the pictures they have on an iPad near the register. Not even cilantro or onion. 
The combo comes with rice and beans which were flavorless and bland. Nothing authentic at all. $7.99

My hubby ordered the carne asada fries. The asada itself tasted good. Not too greasy. This item was pretty good. $8.99

So we went back to give this place another shot. 

I ordered the taco combo again but the street taco style. I specifically asked for extra cilantro and onion. Picture is attached to the review. Cilantro was clearly not fresh, and barely any. The carnitas lacked much flavor and were super dry. Also a very disappointing dish. 

Cheese quesadilla was fine, but way overpriced at $5.99

My husband ordered the burrito combo and realized at home that the combo we paid for was not given to us. 

There is no kids menu and the prices are inflated. 

The service is pleasant and they clearly are trying hard to be hospitable here. 

Bottom line, we're still looking for our go-to Mexican spot that's not some chain. Not even worth complaining to management because the food just isn't that good. And for their price point, I don't anticipate seeing this place stay in business very long.

We have been here twice and they are consistently good!  SO nice to have something other than Roberto's as an option.  They use quality ingredients and not greasy like the rest of the taco joints.  I'm not sure what region they are from but there is something slightly different about their style and we love it!  The man behind the counter/on the phone is super nice and helpful.  Their burritos and nachos are the best we've had.

Came in to try the place since it's new.  My girlfriend ordered carne asada fries and I ordered some different varieties of tacos. The taco meats were tender and good but for me it needed a bit more salt which was easy fix. The carne asada fries is to die for, the fries was double fried with flour and it's crunchy on the outside and soft in the inside, the toppings were really good which complemented the fries. I've had carne asada fries from a lot of places like robertos, tacos el gordo, and even high yelp review score, jefe's tacos. For me the carne asada fries was the highlight of my visit here even though my girlfriend only shared me some. Great food, good service and good price.

One star for the pleasant customer service. One for the social atmosphere and the cool purple light shining on the tables out front. 

Zero stars for the food. I ordered two street style soft tacos. One with Tinga (Marinated "Cardboard" chicken breast) and one Carne Asada (Steak). Each came with cilantro and onions as a garnish.

The steak was bland. No depth of flavor. Very lackluster. Nothing special about it. The chicken was the worst by far. It tasted completely unseasoned. NO flavor at all. It was topped with a flat-tasting red sauce that had a marinara consistency. That was bland too and salty. 

I wanted to like this place so bad and came with an open mind but sorry to say it disappointed big time.

If you're looking for fresh Mexican food this is the place to go to, and it's usually because the food is superb, nothing taste dry like most places and it's not over charged like most Mexican restaurants that do not serve quality eats. 
The staff is very friendly and feels very homey. The service was quick as well. I discovered this place just by simply walking by and I'm glad I did.
It feels good to support our locals here in the valley. I couldn't recommend it more.
Wowwwww!!! This place is amazing! Tacos El Pastor were the best I've ever had. Will be back!!

AMAZING!!!  First of let me start by saying my family and I love real Hispanic foods. We're from So Cal & know good Mexican cusine. This place was off the hook!!! Very small hole in the wall ( always tend to be the best places) seating for maybe 15 people. Don't let the location fool you, they don't have any big signs out front yet either but they're there! My family had carne asada tacos, carne asada fries, steak burrito -dry and steak fajitas. Very reasonably priced! Averaged 6-9$ a plate. And they're full plates! None of us finished all our food. The chips and salsa are fantastic as well! &&& They do free local delivery!! Y'all gotta check them out! Don't let these guys go out of business! We're definitely going to be regulars!

I just took my daughter to this place and we loved it. She got the Carne Asada taco combo I had the Carne Asada burrito. The Carne Asada was the best we have had. We will most definitely be going back.
Been here a few times excellent food excellent service from friendly staff great value large portions and better than some. Of the bigger name Mexican restaurants
This place was awesome. They had phenomenal customer service. Me and my girlfriend both had tacos with different meats and they were all delicious. We will definitely be coming back here.
Great little taco shop. Flavorful house sauces! Fine choice of meats. Fast friendly service.

I visited this business when it first opened and was a bit smaller. They are all amazing with customer service and trying to explain an order that was confusing to me, was sorted quickly with how much they know about their food! 
I'm very impressed at how authentic the food is! 
Food is inexpensive, huge portions, and extremely tasty. What more can you ask for?
I'm glad they expanded and I really hope they stay in that location (that area is very empty, lots of stores still not leased) 
This business makes the community around it better, in my opinion. Great small business, with great food and great service. Bravo!
Make sure you don't miss it, it's hidden next to a Chervon gas station. 

I'm a huge fan of Mexican food and most of the restaurants I've visited for Mexican food, was very non-traditional and had an American twist to it. This place is great REAL Mexican food. (They do have one questionable menu item, cheese fries- other than that, the menu is a great selection of Mexican foods)

They even cater to vegatarians! (Not vegans, they do serve cheese on mostly everything) Inexpensive, authentic, great food, fun & friendly service. I'm possibly addicted to their rice :-) Cheese casadendas are huge! Fresh chips are always great. 
(Place is super clean too!)
Exceeded our expectations. Food was amazing and service was incredible to boot! Will be returning

This new Mexican food joint  is one of the few things that will make me miss living in the NW part of town. We initially discovered them through Yelp delivery and were extremely pleased with our Asada fries, chimichanga with cheese sauce, and nachos. Our second visit was a dine in. The staff was very courteous and helpful, the place was clean with cute modern decor with traditional flare. We did asada fries again, wet burrito and an al pastor taco. We finished all of our food and totally pigged out since the portions are not small. The food was flavorful and contained higher quality ingredients than most Mexican restaurants I've experienced in town (and I have tried many). Like I mentioned, we are now over 30 min away and that makes me sad because I finally found an awesome restaurant for my Mexican food fix. The prices are reasonable for the quality and quantity of food you get.
Just ordered. My order arrived sooner than expected. The food was great, nice & fresh and the driver was friendly. Thumbs up all around. Good stuff !

Came in 10 minutes to close b/c yelp says they close at 10, they close at 9 except for weekends. They took my order anyways. 
From the moment I walked in, I received nothing but great service. The chef even came out and personally made me something since I am vegan and was unsure of what to get. I went with the nachos, (take out) and wow were they incredible! And a great portion too! Asked to try their hot sauces and you could tell they're fresh, and the kind of spice you want at a Mexican restaurant! 
Told my parents about this place and we plan to come in for to sit down soon. 
Keep up the great work! I can't wait to try other options!
Oh, and one last thing. I hear the meat is great for those meat eaters out there!

If you're in the NW area of Las Vegas for some reason, need to eat, and want Mexican food, this is the place to go.  I probably wouldn't drive from the strip to get here, but it is definitely worth it if you're doing things around here.   

The place was a little confusing to find at first due to a recent name change.  We were trying to go to "Tostadas and Tacos" which apparently used to be in the same location as this place.  I'm not sure how this place is associated with the old place, but just be sure you're looking for the right place.  It's in a small strip mall with a few other various places and a Dairy Queen.

We walked in and looked over the menu.  It's pretty much a standard Mexican menu.  I didn't see anything like Menudo or Mole, but they have your typical assortment of Tacos, Burritos, Carne Asada Fries, Nachos, and a few other things like a Sope and Huarache.

I decided to go with the Wet Burrito and a Jarritos.  Then we waited at a table.  We were hungry and it seemed like the wait was a very long time, but the owner assured us it was coming and would be good.  I just about considered going to the nearby Dairy Queen to get an appetizer because I was starving.  The food did come eventually, and it was fantastic.

My Wet Burrito was full of carne asada, smothered in a pretty mild red sauce, and then had some cream on top.  It wasn't overly complex, but it didn't need to be.  It was flavorful.  The sauce was really good and I tried to get as much per bite as I could.  I usually like spicier things, but I was fine not having anything else to spice up this burrito.  

Other than the long wait for food, it was a really good meal.  I have no idea when I'll be back in this area, but if I am I won't hesitate to come here again.

Everything is sooo good! We called and got delivery tonight for the first time. They were super nice and delivered quickly... and for free! We ordered a variety of tacos, mulita, and chips. Everything was fresh and hot when it arrived... and delicious!

Stumbled upon this restaurant while in search of tacos in the northwest and I was not disappointed. I particularly liked the asada tacos, asada fries and chimichanga. The way they dress it up makes it not only delicious but Instagram worthy as well. Order one and see exactly what I mean. The green sauce was pretty good, the red wasn't for me though. 

Notable mention: the owner is a really cool guy who makes me want to visit again. Friendly customer service really goes a long way. They deliver too!
The service was great, but the meat was burned. Bad.  we came here for the reviews. And I don't like leaving a bad review, but for $50 and burned food... what more can I do?

Top tacos on this side of town. I have explored far and wide and went beyond borders to find the ascended mastery of taco flavor. All the meats and their sauces are shockingly good, but I'm partial to the Carne Asada Taco Combo and the deep stewed flavor that they discovered here. The taco is so good that it is mysterious.

Salsas are carefully prepared by hand, deseeding the most hypercharged chilies that are mixed in to their diablo salsa and a carmel-red habanero salsa; truly delicious and powerful salsas.

I was pleasantly surprised by this cozy hole-in-the- wall taco shop. Came here for lunch, I ordered the 3 taco combo plate with asada and my stepmom got a wet burrito with chicken. We dined in and, while the place is obviously set up for mostly take-out, the interior is clean with simple yet classy decor, complete with fancy (real) plates and mason jar glasses that gives it the atmosphere of a more expensive restaurant. To top it off, the food was crafted with restaurant care and quality ingredients for prices that rival fast food, and the service was superb. We spoke with one of the owners, Daniel, briefly and he confessed they'd recently changed the restaurant's feel and businesses practices to be a more welcoming environment for dine in customers. He seemed passionate about creating a great customer experience and providing food that speaks for itself. I wasn't clear if they were new owners, but they seem to know what they're doing. I highly recommend checking this place out!
Came here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised...had the carne asada fries and al pastor taco...really really good...i will definitely be back
Delicious tacos/Mexican food at a very reasonable price. Will definitely return for more chorizo tacos!

Good food! They can make pretty much everything on their menu vegetarian. Friendly staff and food always ready quick, well cooked and so delicious. Worth the price!! I've had a veggie burrito and veggie chimichanga. Both were amazing.

Hidden Gem! 

Where has this place been? I admit i thought twice about the location but once you step in this is a nice, clean and quiet little taqueria with BIG BOLD flavors. Thank you Yelp for not steer me wrong on this one. Food was very fresh and packed full of flavors that are very different from normal around town taqueria's. You can tell Daniel the owner really cares about how the food tastes and the quality. This is a true authentic Mexican taqueria probably even better than these better high price restaurants. 

I try a lot of spots on Yelp and most of the time I will not post anything because it's not worth my time but this one hands down deserves a great review.  

We had a variety of food, Carne Asada Wett Burrito, Al Pastor & Carne Asada Taco and Beef Nachos. Ask to try all the sauces :) YUM

Daniel keep it up, location #2 should be in Summerlin so I don't have to drive so far....but I will defiantly be back. 

FYI....I hear Chronic Taco's on Flamingo/Ft Apache closed down AGAIN. Im sure we know why :)

Without a doubt one of the best taco places in Vegas. You can really taste the quality compared to other places in town. They go the extra mile to source great ingredients which Is rare for a taco shop. After learning they will serve just the carne Assad meat with the choice of rice and beans, it fits my diet. So paleo and keto people will find it easy to pick something out. Also the staff is all really friendly. 

Underrated!
It was our first time there. Very good food. We emptied our plates completely. Daniel is a great, very attentive and very kind waiter. I definitely will come back. Thanks Daniel.

The fruit popsicles here are delicious. I had rolled taquitos and my husband had street tacos. Both were good but nothing special. They have good and interesting salsas. The staff was very friendly and the service was fast. We will probably go back for the ice pops and when we need a quick taco fix.
Really good food and really great service. Super friendly and accommodating. We only ever go in and pick up but the food is ready pretty quickly and always fresh.

Nachos and more Nachos! I wanted to pick up a bite to eat on my way home. I used my Yelp app to pick this place and it was convenient. I ordered and paid for it online. I walked in 25 minutes later and order was ready to go.
 I ordered the Nachos and chimmi style burrito. The super Nachos was awesome and A lot! I didn't even eat half before I was full. The chimmi was good and had a good crunch. Overall I am full with a lot left over for lunch tomorrow.

Went in with my daughter, her husband  and 4 kids. We went on the recommendation of my brother. I almost didn't stay, because the restaurant was small, with only about 10 tables and the menu was written in sharpie on a white board. I'm so glad we stayed!! The owners were friendly and welcoming and the food was delicious!! They opened with home made chips and a fabulous salsa. We had carne asada French fries and loved them. All the meat on their tacos and the vegetables in my veggie burrito were cooked in the most delicious sauce, that was not spicy....just flavorful. We will definitely be back!!

Ok. I received 2 notifications about this new restaurant near my work. I have tried all the other lunch spots so I figured I'd give it a shot. So many great reviews and the word "authentic" thrown around quite a bit. Today I went and ordered a Carne as ada chimichanga. Let me say.....the customer service and attitude of the proprietors was excellent. They were very nice and friendly.  I was really wanting to like the food. Unfortunately. ...I didn't.  I have NEVER  had a wet burrito or chimichanga covered with a velveeta style cheese. It ruined the flavor of the chimi. The meat was good quality but lacking a little flavor. I couldn't finish it and went back to work a little bummed out. I wish success for this place but people giving it 5 stars have misrepresented reality here. Maybe some asada fries next time....

Service was awesome! I placed my order to go, I only waited 10 mins. Location is easy to get to. Tons of parking. The restaurant itself is small and cozy. Now to the important stuff! The food. I ordered the mulitas (quesadilla with carne asada) let's start with the tortillas were pre-made Instead of handmade which I'm not used to normally they come with handmade tortillas. The meat was seasoned very flavorful, it had tons of cheese that was my favorite part. I also ordered a carne asada burrito which was very tasty! Last but not least their salsas were very flavorful! Yummy!
Really Really great Mexican food. Atmosphere is clean with great tunes. Definitely will be making this my north/west Mexican joint for the family. 5 STARS!

I'm not usually a fan of nacho cheese, but I got the super nachos and actually didn't mind it. If you get the nachos eat them there or right away if you're taking them to go. Only because the nacho cheese makes its soggy and it's not the same. Over all the place is clean, great employees and good nachos !

Can I start this review with three words? Carne Assad Fries. This place is small but the food here is amazing. The staff is super friendly and knows how to treat their customers. Home made salsa freshly done everyday. Seriously, you gotta try this place, you will thank me later! I take tacos.
The guy at the front or rude and condescending. Food is good though, but lost my interest in this place after the way he greeted us.

I order 2 steak taco which came with cilantro,  onion and salsa which was very tasty.  They also have california Mexican popsicles. 

The restaurant was clean the customer service is 10+.  He gave my daughter  the incorrect order but gave us the Mexican popsicles that we we're going to pay for free for the order mishap.  

The owner also gave us a little history on the art display. 

I will definitely return when visiting Vegas again.

Ordered Carne Asada Street tacos. Owner brought complementary warm house made chips and salsa roja. Nice touch. The tacos were packed with quality tender beef. Lime wedge on the side. Appreciated. Looking forward to checking out the burritos next visit. A great addition to the neighborhood. A cold beer to go along with the tacos would make it a perfect lunch. I'll be back.

I ordered delivery through Yelp from them and it was phenomenal. Plenty of options. I'm not a huge beef person but I decided on the ground beef quesadillas w/ 3 churros and Mexican coke and was so far from disappointed. Plus, they arrived fairly quick and the delivery person was super nice. The meat was so full of flavor and I've already told a bunch of people about this place. New favorite Mexican restaurant!

I've been here 3 times now, & after being supremely disappointed by the previous 3 mexican restaurants located in this strip mall site, (not surprisingly, they all failed), I can finally say that Sin Fronteras is a gem that does all the standards of mexican fare very, very well. It's obvious that the owner, Daniel, truly cares for his recipes, & customers. He greets me every time I come in. He is very particular about quality control, & it shows in his salsas, balanced flavors & cooking methods. I am so glad to have Sin Fronteras in the neighborhood!

Let me say that I've been to a few Mexican eateries and this one came in first place. A couple bonuses I must share. First, you can order and pay online.  Second, the portion size of the food is equal to the cost! I ordered the carnitas loaded nachos. The meat was flavorful and not dry. Their spicy red sauce can be put on anything and it enhances the flavor! Their chips look home made and taste home made. They added the right amount of cheese for every bite and their crema/sour cream is distributed throughout. I hate clumped chunks of sour cream btw. I also ordered a burrito and the portion is a two meal size for sure. For craving satisfied I say YES! I'm happy!

Let me start by saying I never leave reviews on account of not feeling so inclined to write one. This is the first place I've tried that made me want to.

From the moment you walk in you can tell this place is different. There was a friendly smile awaiting us and a full explanation of everything as we went. The gentlemen that helped us really wanted our experience to be great. I can't say the same at most places.

We ordered the asada fries and a carne asada burrito. All ingredients were fresh and of a very high quality. We were even served chips and salsa while we waited(very sturdy chips as well). With this quality no excessive price is paid. On top of that the drinks offered were at a more than fair price point (soda, energy drinks, etc) for the customer.

Needless to say, we will be back. Highly recommend.
Great Street Tacos, fresh ingredients, and friendly service.  After my first visit, I became a devoted regular. It is very convenient to order online, and easy for pickup or delivery. Winn

Great food. Very fresh and all made in house. We've tried tacos, mulitas, fajitas, and a couple of other things and it's just plain good. The service has also been as good as the food. Highly recommend this place. Can't go wrong!
The food was delicious! Great service , very unique place to eat with the fam. The tacos where the bomb...

Was just in the area looking to grab some lunch. This place has awesome street tacos and the best chips!!! I think they fried the chips right before they brought them out. Had the Al Pastor, Carne Asada, and chicken tacos. Everything was delicious! Great service too

Delicious!!!! My coworker and I love this place! Savory. Fresh and yummy! 
Reasonable prices and friendly staff!!!!
An amazing new stop for good Mexican food! The food is always hot and fresh to order. The carne asada fries are the bomb!!! Would recommend this place ten fold!

Oh Lord, their street tacos are righteous.  Went twice in three days cause I had to get me some of their carnitas.  Al pastor, too.  Oh, and their Carne Asada fries....whaaaaaaatttt?!?!  Should be illegal they're so tasty.  Pour some of their Diablo salsa over everything while you're at it. 
Real nice owners to boot!  So glad you guys are in the neighborhood!
My new favorite place for tacos and it's right in my neighborhood.  Best mexican food in town!
Great service. Tacos and burritos were delicious. Asada fries were amazing, but in my opinion better without the nacho sauce. Have been here twice!

Let me just start off by saying that I dreaded writing this. I even thought about, not writing this at all. But you can't make everyone happy and that's the truth. Well, I'm one of them. I was on call and haven't had dinner so I got on yelp and found this place for delivery. Delivery was quick and the carne asada fries were actually better than the other places I've ordered from. So let me say that I will give this place another try but I won't be ordering the carnitas super nachos. Took one bite of this and I lost my appetite. Could it be that one piece of meat? Idk but it was gross and I couldn't even continue chewing that I had to get rid of it. Sorry but that's what happened. 
Really though, the fries were good.

Small family shop is small retail strip. Had a 3 taco combo: chorizo, carne asada, & carnitas. Ate inside. Had seating for around a dozen. After ordering I sat down and they brought me small bowl of nice chips and a very nice deep rojo salsa. Taco combo came with rice and beans. All meat was nice, not over cooked and seasoned & sauced. Enjoyed every last bite.
The food was ok... I probably wouldn't come back though because everything had no flavor to it. I had to season everything at home for it to taste good.

Today I was looking on yelp for a New Mexican restaurant and I found Sin Fronteras, I got the three taco combo with chicken  and Carne Asada,  it came with rice and beans! it is so amazing, they cook to order so everything is fresh. I will most definitely be coming back here!
They have the nicest service. The food is presented so great! Enjoying these carne Assad fries really well!!
Delicious spot for tacos and carne asada fries! Try the green sauce!! Come and check it out when you are in the 89129 area!

4.5. The location is nondescript with poor lighting doing little to shed light on a largely dark parking lot. Farmers insurance to the far left, a Dairy Queen slightly closer, and a gas station on the corner, Sin Fronteras Tacos can do little to stand out. Without curb appeal, clientele, I was informed, relied purely on word of mouth.

"3 weeks", he said in response to my question. He'd been open a fairly short time, and it turns out ownership lies in threes. The trio all share a mutual history in food, each working in different restaurants. Though the choice of locale is curious, their combined experience from working in major Strip properties tips the scales in their favour.

Once entering, there is a noticeable cloud of smoke which will permeate through clothing if dining in. Seating is fairly slim due to a lack of tables though this may change since SFT is still in it's infancy. It apparent there was a goal of visual modernity which makes the worn orange tile-work from owners past look out of place, especially when compared to the stone counter top.

After ordering carne fries, and nachos sans meat; what came was a wet burrito instead of the fries. A shrug and a "food is food" mentality ensured the burrito was there to stay. The outer layer was crisped to prevent sogginess, which was much appreciated, with the interior stuffed with rice, salsa, cilantro, and surprisingly, not a single piece of fatty cuts whatsoever. The topping was a too heavy in taste, however,. Side note: cilantro lime rice as an alternative would have been fantastic. The nachos were topped perfectly, though lacked layers, and left an awkward bed of virgin chips underneath.

Would recommend. Maybe I'll get the fries next time.

This place is fantastic! Friendly staff, fast delivery, and everything is so delicious. Chorizo enchiladas, carnitas chimichanga, fajita burrito, the street tacos are darn tasty, and the carne Asada nachos are amazing! Can't get enough

This Place is Amazing! Everything HOMEMADE! From Scratch: the several types of Salsa's, Fresh Cooked Chips, Refried Beans, and Homemade Horchata. Traditional Mexican Bottled Coke and Jarrito's. Perfect Balance between the Deep, Red Majado Sauce, Thick and Rich  and contrasting Smooth, Thin Traditional Mexican Sour Cream. The Service is Spot On, Engaging, and Friendly. Felt Welcomed and Will Return For Sure. To the Owners, You Got It DOWN! Continue with your Attention to Detail and Follow Your Dreams! Can't wait to see where THIS BUSINESS GOES! Thanks for a Great Experience 3 Days in Row! Perfect!
Great food and awesome customer service!!! We will definitely be back. The food is amazing and destroys the other taco shops in town!
Great Food,  Great Service, Great Experience! You must stop here for your Mexican Fix!  Bravo Daniel!

I'm an Uber Eats driver , happened to get a pickup here today . Upon entry I noticed it's a small establishment , nothing fancy , has a white board menu , etc . The man who was working the register and greeted me was awesome . Tons of personality . Very friendly . Pickup was ready to go in 3 minutes , filled all the drinks , had a drink carrier , etc . Food smelt amazing in my car . After delivering I figured I'd go check it out for myself . Same man recognized me , greeted me , made me feel at home . I ordered the chicken cheese quesadilla combo with beans and rice and a Mexican coke . He dropped the drinks off at the table & asked if I wanted and sauces . Food was 10/10 awesome . The cook in the back rocks it . Highly recommended !
Food is awesome. Service is awesome. A little pricey but well worth it. Everything is cooked to order.

Delicious food! Great quality carne asada! The food is flavorful and worth every penny. We got the carne asada Fries 5/5, carne asada chimichanga 5/5 and carne asada burrito 5/5. I will definitely be back!

The new era of robertos is upon us. This restaurant is going to be my new hot spot for Mexican eats.. OMG the food was fresh and delicious! Clean dishes clean surfaces and a very kind staff they gave us 4 sauces to try with our meals and made sure we had all our needs met! Must try for yourself! The carne Assad was so tender

If you know anything about your traditional carne asada street tacos these are not it. The cook or owner told us he charges $2.50 a taco because of the high quality of meat. Well if you use good meat why cover up the taste with a lot of tasteless sauce. They were literally smothered in sauce just like red chile meat with absolutely no taste. Not recommending this place at least not the carne asada tacos.
This place is amazing, rarely you get good food and service to go along with it. Al Pastor the best I've had, portion size are great. Definitely coming back here it's a must try!!!!!
Food was great!  Delivered to my door with everything as ordered; nothing missing and special instructions followed to a T!  I would highly recommend!

I've had better tacos in town, that's for sure. I had the al pastor tacos, and it taste like they might of marinated a bit too long. The texture was exactly like I tried to do it myself when I put too much vinager in the marinade, and let it sit too long. My son had the carna  asada tacos, he said he's had better and wasn't worth the price. They were also the small tortillas and for $2.50 plus a taco, I won't be going back soon unless I'm starving and I need a taco. Even if I was, there's a Roberto's close.

This place is amazing! The staff is super nice and friendly. They are very detailed with their ingredients and options in food. They sound happy to be answering the phones and are very quick with the service. We usually order Al Pastor fries, and a carne asada burrito. Their fries are the best in the city! The cheese blend is so delicious. Their agua frescas can use some work though.

4 stars cuz of service and just genuine niceness. Came in and the dude at the front was de-seeding chillies (legit). I ordered a bunch of stuff and a horchata. He gave me the horchata, told me to sip on it till the food was done, then he gave me an top up. The mulitas were the stand out star . Got the ground beef mulitas, very good combo. Salsas all homemade.  I love local businesses and nice folk. Keep up the good work.
Had their Al pastor nachos and a frozen desert was delicious! Great customer service. I will be back for more soon

We're in Vegas on vacation & decided to try places off the strip. On our way back from hiking, this place popped up on Yelp. It had great reviews and my husband and I definitely agree with the 5 star reviews! The restaurant is small & quaint with about 6 small tables. The decor and music give it a homey vibe. The food is great! We ordered the carne asada nachos (one of the best meals I've had!), chicken flautas, a carne asada sope, and a chorizo taco. Everything was delicious! The nachos were my favorite! If you're ever in the area, this place is a must!

This is the place to go to for authentic Mexican food with great flavors! I had the carne asada super nachos and my boyfriend had the burrito. We each also tried the Tinga and al pastor tacos. The chipotle sauce that they add has a great Smokey/spicy flavor. I would have to say the nachos were my favorite. Mozzarella cheese, chipotle sauces another salsa added with diced onions, tomatoes and sour cream with tender steak, so delicious! It was our second time but both times were so impressed with the food and the service also. Very friendly and accommodating and they make everything fresh to order. Last thing the churros are a great way to finish off with dessert.

My husband and I have not been able to find a good Mexican restaurant until now. So happy that we found Sin Fronteras! The food is delicious! The chimichanga and huraches are amazing. And their chicken tinga  is so tasty. My husband likes his hard shell taco's with ground beef, but it's hard to find a restaurant that sells them other than taco bell. But Sin Fronteras offers ground beef and believe me they are way better than taco bell. We also enjoy the friendly staff they always make us feel welcome. We will be visiting here often.
Yummy carne asada street tacos! They didn't skimp on meat like a lot of places do, and their green sauce is delicious. Thank you!

After transplanting from San Diego to Las Vegas, I struggled to find comparable Mexican food. Finally, I found Sin Fronteras. I ordered from Yelp and the owner delivered the food himself, he called first as they were out of one of the items to ensure I received something similar. When he arrived he was SO kind, he found out we recently relocated and was quick to give recommendations and stand in the driveway to chat. The food was the closest I have tasted to San Diego since. Great chimichangas and churros and they are so quick! We haven't ordered from another Mexican food shop since. I highly recommend this place.

Great food and awesome service. I found the place on yelp and wanted to try somewhere new. The Asada fries have an enchilada sauce added that gives a different approach and yummy taste. The chimichanga was also full of flavor.

Food here was excellent especially the street tacos and the El Pastor meat. The side sauces were exceptionally good as well. Definitely would go back again and also the hospitality and the gentleman in the front was really a super great guy!!

Outstanding customer service! Complementary chips and salsa are always a plus. I had the taco combo well worth it... carnitas tacos we're delicious the rice was good (and I'm picky with my rice lol) Definitely coming back.

Awesome. Awesome taco spot! On a whim I searched for a taco place with carry out and this place popped up. It's so good that I ate my food before I was able to upload a picture. 

The salsa was spicy, the guacamole was nice and fresh and the tortillas were just right.


As a Californian you'll fine me constantly poo-poo'ing Las Vegas Mexican food as inferior but this shop hit a homerun with me!
Excellent little taco shop, carne asada, pastor, and carnitas tacos were all on point. Pricing very reasonable. Will definitely be back!

Um.... YUM!!! It's hard to find really good tacos in Vegas and these are really, really good tacos. I tried one each of the carnitas, pollo asado, and carne asada. I'm usually a freak for carnitas and yes, the carnitas was delicious, but holy moly the carne asada was phenomenal. So much flavor. Everything was really fresh, juicy, and well-seasoned, and their hot sauce/salsa had just enough kick to marry really well with the rich and tasty meat. I got rice and beans on the side - the rice was solid but the beans were better.

Washed it all down with an icy cold lemonade and let with a churro for the road. I'm so used to crappy churros I almost wasn't going to get one and I'm so glad we did. Fresh, crispy on the outside and just the right amount of slightly doughy softness on the inside, perfect dusting of sugar and cinnamon. Two thumbs way up.

Don't expect a bunch of shredded lettuce, pre-fab cheese nonsense. This is the real deal - awesome food made by awesome people.

Btw - my husband is obsessed with the breakfast burrito. Obsessed. He'll drive all the way across town for one and that's a high compliment indeed.

So far... I'm loving this place. They've been consistent each and every time I've placed phone orders. My go to order is their chicken tinga nachos with guac. My husband has ordered their chicken dry and wet with green salsa burritos and liked them as well. Their food tastes authentic and not greasy at all. Good quality. Very pleased with their service too.

This place is wonderful! The food was absolutely delicious, the dining area was clean and welcoming, and the staff are the nicest people in the food industry in Las Vegas. The owner and the chef bent over backwards to accommodate our large group after a long day of softball at Majestic Park. Everyone in our party was more than pleased with their food - the carne asada fries, burritos, and chimichangas were among the favorites! And the refined beans were perfect! We were dreading trying to find a place where we could all eat together (36 of us!), and this place went above and beyond to make it happen. If you are looking for a welcoming local atmosphere, fabulous Mexican food, and friendly faces that will treat you like family, this is the place for you!

Excellent food. Good size portions, burritos are huge. I have LOVED everything I've tried so far. The homemade house salsa is amazing. My mouth waters just thinking of it. Authentic flavors. They do custom orders too... just ask.
My current Favs: Carnitas Chimichanga wet (the sauce is divine!), Asada wet burrito, Al Pastor tacos, Chorizo Breakfast Burrito, Chicken quesadilla, and Assad Fries!
The horchata isn't as sweet as other places, but I totally prefer it.
Great service, totally personable and they make an effort to get to know their regulars.
---UPDATE--- 
They have expanded the menu. In addition to the fabulous street tacos, they now offer hard shell tacos. My husband was pleased, he ordered the Al Pastor (seasoned pork and pineapple). The kids menu has mac & cheese now too.
Appreciate that the environment is disabled and sensory friendly. They are always accommodating and happy to make a custom order for our autistic son.

Never have I been in a Mexican taco joint with jazz music playing in the background and it was great. I'm surprised it was dead at lunch on a Tuesday but food came out fast fresh. The carne asada nachos are a tower of delishishness with the red and cheese sauce. I'm drooling thinking about my next trip back.

My new taco spot. This place has very high quality and good tasting food with good prices. We are done with Roberto's  so we tried this place yesterday for takeout. It was very good. We had the wet carne asada burrito, carne asada chimichanga, cheese quesadilla, rice and beans. The salsa had a chipotle flavor which was great. My husband said that there is a new owner from what he was told. This is a great Mexican Restaurant and refreshing option for takeout.

Came here to explore a little "hole in the wall" restaurant, but this is so much more than that!! This food is just like what my mom or abuelita might make. The food is legit and authentic, and on top of that the entire staff was extremely helpful and nice. We'll definitely be back.

This place is great! The tacos were amazing! The asada is a good cut and cooked perfectly. The al pastor had great flavor, but the thing that really makes it, and reminds me of the old taquerias before there were a billion of them in town is the tortillas. Doesn't seem like a big deal, but I think that tortillas can make or break a taco.  Also where al pastor fries were mad indulgent and delicious.

This is the best tacos restaurant in Las Vegas. Hidden gem in Northwest Las Vegas. Owners are friendly & very efficient in service. Foods served fresh & hot. I'm so glad to have found this restaurant when I'm craving for authentic tacos. I will be back!
Perfect example of authentic Mexican food with respect for ingredients, flavor, and freshness definitely recommend you eat here if you're in the area

Located in the Quail Tree plaza, small taco shop, HUGE FLAVOR! Had the chimichanga. Smothered in a spectacular cheese sauce and able to be cut with a fork! The carne asada in side was seasoned beautifully and the dish was plated like a gourmet establishment! Finished with the flan that was so good I may have dreams about it. Also for a small corner shop the service was great! Friendly and engaging!

5 out of 5 

Would highly recommend and will be returning soon...

Simply amazing! The ground beef burrito is delicious! Tons of flavor, hot food, large portions and great salsa. You walk in this joint thinking its a regular Mexican food place but you're greeted by an Asian dude who is the most courteous worker I've ever freaken met! This dude should do seminars on how good his customer service is... Yeah he is that good. The only thing I'd change in this place is the music! Lol! CCR was playing instead of traditional music. The place is super clean too, but the restrooms are around the building

I've seen good reviews on yelp for this place and have always meant to try it out. Today, after running some morning errands, I drove past it and thought that I'd try it now. I was greeted by a very nice man. Since I got there just when they opened we had some time to kill. We talked about some of our favorite places to eat, how important it is to support local businesses, and how great their food was. I liked him and his confidence. I was really hoping the food was as good as he said it was. And guess what?? It was!!! It was amazing!!! I ordered two-3 item combo meals, so 6 tacos total. All street tacos, per his recommendation. I got 2 carne asada, 1 chicken, 2 al pastor, and 1 carnitas. Now it was all REALLY good. The carnitas were definitely my favorite, and I'm pretty much a carnitas snob. I read another review about the cilantro being "old" and the person posted a picture. Mine looked just like that and obviously the person never cooks or eats cilantro. When it's placed on something hot, it gets a little wilted and dark green. This makes it yummy though! When I put it in my soups, it's just like this. Everything was fresh and yummy. I'll definitely be back and I think it will be a new favorite of mine. It REALLY makes me happy that it opens at 10am too! No pictures this time because my husband and I scarfed them down quickly.

My girlfriend and I came to try this place we hear from some friends. To be honest, we weren't really expecting much, but it turned out to be a really good place to eat. I highly recommend their Carne Asada fries and the Huarache!

Found a spot that beats "Tacos Mexico"!!! I've been getting my Chorizo breakfast burrito from Tacos Mexico I would say about 2 to 3 times a week. My sister calls me up to ask if I wanted anything from this new place they found, and if you know me then you know that I'm not one to turn down FOOD, so I order their Chorizo burrito. First bite and BAMMMMM!!! I'm hooked for life!! Really recommend this place if u like your breakfast burritos. Haven't really tried anything else but I don't doubt that it's all pretty good!! I'm a customer for life!!!

Arrived hungry to my hotel. Ordered street tacos - carnitas.  And a beef burrito.  Asked for spicy. They included 2 containers of different hot sauces.  The tacos were great. Carnitas moist and flavorful. 

Burrito good sized. Tasty. Only thing I would have preferred is less beans in the burrito.  But still great.  

Delivery was fast and easy. Ordered via the yelp app.
This place is a win every time. The meat is tender and has tons of flavor. I've had this place 3x since moving in the area and they've never disappointed.

Came here because I live nearby and was pleasantly surprised by the service here. Greeted by the owner and got my food quickly. The carne asada burrito was delicious. Also the horchata was a nice refreshment.

Absolute amazing. They have upgraded the steak multiple times and you can tell. The angus beef is delicious. They have the best chimichanga I've ever Tasted in my life. The carne asada fries will put robertos out of business. Everything is delicious there. Very rarely do I leave reviews but that's the least I can do for somewhere that provides such great food and service.

My mom and I decided to try this place after reading the great reviews my fellow Yelpers left. Unfortunately we were somewhat disappointed. 

The food wasn't horrible, but neither of us could understand why they put canned vegetables on beef enchiladas, and in a fajita burrito. I'm talking about Veg-all you guys! The mix of green beans, corn, carrots and peas! I've eaten a lot of Mexican food, and I've NEVER seen this before. 

To top it off the meat wasn't inside the enchilada my mom had. It was a cheese enchilada with meat, potatoes, and vegetables on top. 

I want to be clear here, the taste of the food wasn't bad, it just wasn't what we were expecting. The Veg-all was a total turn off. We won't be going back.

found it! a great mexican taco shop with excellent food and customer service. this place just open down the street from my house and i just happen to be on yelp as we were running around doing errands looking for a place to eat and this place popped up. looking at other's reviews and pictures, my boyfriend and i went with high hopes to finally find a good place and found it! 

the food is fresh and made to order. the customer service was excellent. the gentleman talked about different menu items, what was popular with their customers and what he recommended personally. one of the cooks/chefs also came out while we were eating to see how we liked everything. our plates were spotless! it was so damn good!

we ordered: 

carne asada burrito; wet (with their famous cheese sauce on the outside.) 10/5...yes 10/5 it was that good! the carne asada was tender and full of flavor and the other ingredients rice, pico, sour cream made everything that much better. 

tacos: 
carnitas 5/5 full of flavor, tender, and juicy! 
carne asada 4/5 tender and full of flavor 
chicken tenga 3/5 flavorful but nothing over the top 

green salsa 5/5 spicy and yummy!

I assumed this would be just another hole in the wall taco shop (still on the hunt to find a place that can compare to LA Taco Truck tacos out here in LV), surprisingly it wasn't bad, their meat is marinated well and tasted good. One thing that stood out though, if you need a place to buy rice and retried beans, come here. Probably the best I've tasted in awhile.

Live right across the street, finally decided to try this place out. I'm definitely not disappointed!! Got the asada fries and had a nice chat with the owner. Super friendly guy who is VERY passionate about his place!! Can't wait to go back and try more items!!

Have you ever had a dream? Well, I did and it came true! My dream was to find a perfect taco, and not only that, but to have it close to home. I've been here twice now, and both times were so great, my boyfriend and I are left satisfied and excited for the next time we come. 

The first time we came in, we were greeted by a friendly employee. I explained it was my first time here so it might take a minute for us to decide what to get! (Mostly because i'm so indecisive!) She said not to worry, and gave us their handheld menu because they had pictures on there and it was a little more detailed. I found it super helpful!

So on our 1st trip, we decided to get a few tacos, one combo taco meal, and 2 churros. 
2 chicken, 3 carne asada and 2 carnitas tacos in total, and the combo came with rice and beans. Their carne asada tacos were perfection! So so so good. Did i mention they were good? The chicken and carnitas were super good too, but to me carne asada takes the cake! The rice and beans that came with the combo were good as well. Not amazing, but good! And seeing as ths tacos were amazing, we really didn't care anyways! Now, for the churros.... we actually had to wait a little longer for our food because they were preparing our churros fresh! I mean we didn't care, it made us happy that they were fresh! And man were they good! So warm, crispy, sugary galore.
For our 2nd trip, my boyfriend got tacos again, and I got a burrito. We also got their carne asada fries to share. He tried the al pastor tacos and said they were suuuuper good. He still loves carne asada more but he thinks its cause beef is life :P  I got the carne asada burrito "chimmi" style, and man was that thing big! Covered in cheese and yummy-ness. I loved this burrito! It was so filling! My only mistake was forgetting i hate soggy things so towards the end when the tortilla got a little soggy i didn't want it lol. The carne asda fries were amazing though, the fries were crispy golden and deliciousss! 

Anyways, this is our favorite taco place, and I highly recommend it to everyone! Its a great find, I don't think people know that they're missing out if they haven't been here! :)

I got a Yelp notification about this place so I decided to try it out. I was NOT disappointed! The pictures don't do it justice. The best part is they are affordable and they deliver! I'm recommending this place to people for sure!!!

Make sure to checkout this hidden gem nestled off Alexander in a small shopping plaza. I've been here twice and the food has been good both times. My mother is obsessed with tacos, so I make sure to bring her some when I can. 

Picked up some carne asada, al pastor, and chorizo tacos for the family. Wish they were bigger but they hit the spot. My go to is the chimichanga. Good size and wonderful taste. Definitely check them out.

Great customer service and great food.  A MUST VISIT!!  Employees are engaging and super pleasant.  Owner actually seems like he is interested in being quality place,  which nowadays a lot of places don't.  Don't waste your time at big chain resturants. Check them out!!

We just moved to the area from Chicago, and we were desperate to find a new taco place. SO SO happy we found this place. We've only had the tacos so far but we can't wait to try more of the menu. Tacos are super tasty and the guac is VERY fresh. The fries were awesome too... wasn't expecting that from a Mexican restaurant!

Checked out this spot off Tenaya. A little taco shop with a lot of flavor. Dan at the front was awesome. Had great suggestions and was very hospitable. I had 6 tacos which were packed for street tacos. The carnitas was my favorite but all were tasty. My friend had the wet burrito and devoured it. We will both be back. Definately a hidden gem!
Great street tacos plate and great red sauce and great customer service can't wait to go back next time going for the carne asada burrito

This place has the best tacos in town!! Best Service and great people. Try there hot sauces you will love it.
Don & Susan

We were looking for Mexican food that delivered and Sin Fronteras Tacos appeared to be new so we gave them a try. We ordered a carne asada quesadilla, the three taco combo plate  with carne asada street style, a carnitas street style taco, a chorizo street style taco and the chimichanga style burrito smothered in their cheese sauce. They were delicious! The tacos were loaded with meat, same with the chimi and quesadilla which made for a very filling lunch. We had extras left over and I can't wait to get at them later! Definitely will be getting our business again!!

One of the best places I've had tacos and burritos at. The prices are amazing. I'm surprised that there prices aren't so high considering that there food is so great. Service is also amazing. The owner is also super dope, polite, and really cares about his customers.

Quiet, quaint, and excellent food. I came in here thinking I'd grab a quick bite and be on my way but I was floored by how delicious these El pastor tacos were! The asada fries are a must as well! 

I usually have tacos everywhere that I go and I have to say these were the best tacos I've had in Vegas after Tacos El Gordo. Both places now have big chunks of my foodie heart! 

Bravo muchachos!

I'm not big in reviewing on Yelp, but I had to take a minute because this place was so good!  The restaurant is clean and inviting.  I ordered the mojado carne asada burrito.  I got it custom with steak, beans, cheese, mojado sauce on top with crema and cilantro. The flavors were just amazing.  You could tell the steak was a quality that you don't often find in a burrito and seasoned very well.  The beans were also done very well and all the flavors were very authentic.  The burrito visually was stunning and tasted even better then it looked.  The chef/owner and I had a 10 minute conversation about our passion for food.  Really amazing food!  I would highly recommend it to anyone!!
Best best best best!!!!! We're hooked! Delicious high quality food and impeccable service. Very favorite place hands down. Eat here people. Today!

I thoroughly enjoyed the street tacos. My friend and I had one of each and also ordered extra asada and pastor tacos. Customer service is really great and friendly. The server is very passionate and you can tell he cares about the food and customer. Good tacos, and very good limes. Would come again.

A welcomed find in our neighborhood! Ordered some taco plates, asada fries and a churro. Portions were great and the food was even better. Ordered delivery and there were no problems with the order, even added the requested salsa. Seemed like the delivery driver really cared about our order and taking care of us. We will definitely be stopping by for some asada fries again.

I came down to this area today to have lunch with my boyfriend who works next door at The Original Barber Shop! (Check it out)  Anyway, my boyfriend told me this place was really good! The owner is VERY nice. The food was delicious, I had the breakfast burrito. It was quite big so I had to take half of it to go! After we ate we wanted to try the churros. My boyfriend got up to buy them and the owner said the churros were on them because he felt like our food took a while to come out. WHICH IT DID NOT! It was a really nice gesture and the owner is very grateful. Definitely will be coming back.

This place Rocks! Went in thinkin it'd be a little taco shop, like a Roberto's or somthin, so when I saw the menu I thought it was a little over priced. No way though! Super good, great food and the house made hot sauce. Not sure about the people who didn't give good reviews
Love this place! Always good, always fresh! Chorizo, and shredded chicken is the best.
Every time I go there everything is so fresh and so tasty! They are the best in this area easily. Friendly and fast as well! The best al pastor I've ever had
Must Try! Great food with lots of flavor.  Awesome hospitality and the food is served on real plates, very nice.
This Mexican restaurant hidden in a quiet strip mall off of teneya and Alexander  is by far one of my favorite authentic Mexican restaurant.

Great little quick service Mexican restaurant.  Food was outstanding and the quality of the ingredients were impressive.  No fat on any of the meats (I tried the 3 taco platter and had a carnitas, pastor, and Asada).  All three meats had great flavor!  The prices are very reasonable (8.99 for three street tacos with rice and beans).  Great service too!  The guys are very friendly.  The place is nice inside and clean.  Located in a little strip mall next to Dairy Queen on the corner of Tenaya and Alexander.  I will definitely be back! Can't wait to try the chimichanga.

GREAT MEXICAN FOOD for once in Las Vegas!  The spices were subtle and the meat was marinated perfectly.  Everything was quickly prepared with care.  It was so nice to have 100% FRESH food - nothing frozen or canned. 

The staff was so nice, friendly and attentive.  A great unexpected treasure!

This was my first time eating here and I have to say it was very delicious. I ordered the 3 taco combo carne asada n side salsa which was spicy just the way I like it but the tacos didn't have enough cilantro or onion. I also ordered mexican coca-cola total was $11.85. The food was fresh and very tasty and it is authentic Mexican food. The rice and beans were just okay. Next time I will skip the rice n beans but I will definitely be coming back to give it another try. :-)

My husband and I are always in search of good Mexican restaurants in town, especially ones close to home. Tried this for the first time last night and was beyond satisfied. The Carne Asada and Chicken were marinated very well in our Burrito and Quesadillas. The Carne Asada was so tender. The rice was also a winner, it was so full of flavor and complimented the rest of our meal very nicely.

Burritos are on the "smaller" side but still great burrito.  Great customer service as well! The owner/staff is super friendly and take care in making the burritos.  The flavors and ingredients are fresh and well portioned inside the burritos.  California burrito is super good.  Veggie is also great.

I have been praying for a great neighborhood taco joint!!!!! And I found it!!! Daniel one of the owners is freaking legit he has his business in order and his customer service is above a 5 star. I had the carne asada fries and they weren't greasy and soggy they were freshly made and crispy. The asada is tender and out of this world. Definitely coming here as often as possible.

We have never been disappointed. The only reason it's not a 5 Star review is because I personally don't like ANY fat on my steak and about one piece per taco has some. Otherwise everything is really tasty, the staff is friendly, and it's a good portion of food. I usually save half just to eat for leftovers.

Holy hot damn, this place is the digs! I got a breakfast burrito this morning from here and it did not disappoint. I have to pay bills today and run errands and this burrito made my day. I almost don't want to say how awesome this place is just because I want it to be my new digs. Service is awesome, food is awesome, five stars all day!
Best burritos and nachos ever! Clean environment and prompt service customer service is excellent!
Great Mexican food, good prices. Full of flavor made to order and awesome. Customer service is always great as well.

Pretty good stuff.  Very filling.   Got a chicken quesadilla and guacamole with chips.   Quesadilla could have used a bit more cheese.   Otherwise it was all pretty tasty.  They have the Mexican coca-cola products with real sugar.  Awesome.

The love and caring that the owners put into this cute little taco shop translates to some really flavorful and tasty food, but part of anything is the experience and the desire to comfort you through food and the incredible flavors...leaves in one in anticipation of the next visit. The place is simple and cute and clean design provides a great welcoming. Service is warm welcoming and go above and beyond...I am so excited that we have a restaurant that is not a chain, that  is mom and pop, that brings a fresh new energy to an area that is dotted with chains...please support, these kind of restaurants are the key to restaurants taking a risk and bringing flavorful and tasty food to vegas.

Best tacos in the Northwest of Vegas so far. Al pastor tacos were delicious. Very generous in the meat.. Pieces of pineapple in it. The salsas are all amazing. My son had a burrito with asada. That too was very flavorful. Beans are tasty rice is a lil bland but their salsas make that better. Will definitely return

I gave Sin Fronteras one star soley based on the lack of customer service that I received. I have been looking for good Mexican food since I moved to Vegas and I thought I found it. Although they are not the fastest restaurant I am willing to wait because the food was good and until yesterday the service has always been friendly. I was the first customer of the day when I placed my order and the person who took my order asked me to give them 15 minutes because the kitchen was just opening. I gave them 20. When I arrived to pick up my food I was told that I was early. I expressed that actually it had been 20 minutes. I was told that I was early in general and the guy continued to express how displeased he was with me . Needless to say I did not feel welcomed nor will I ever return.
This taco shop has it going on. They have all the typical taco shop foods, but everything seems made a little better than most other shops. The food isn't greasy, and they have the guava Juaritos.

The food is fresh and tastes great plus the customer service is top notch.  My 12 year old son is a picky eater, but this is his favorite resturant.  Only issue is the lack of a salsa bar...but this place is newly opened and there's always room for improvement!  Try it, you won't be sorry.

I had been wanting to check this place out for a couple of weeks and finally decided to stop by last week. I ordered the asada fries and an horchata to go. The asada fries were delicious! The meat was so full of flavor and not too thick, just how I like it. I asked the guy for the salsa on the side, just in case it was too spicy. Once I tried it, it was perfect. It had just the right amount of kick (at least for me). Before we left, my son wanted to try my horchata and ended up knocking it over and spilled it on the floor and table. The guy who took my order came over and cleaned it up and even refilled my horchata. 

I will definitely be back!

I was born & raised in Los Angeles so I love Mexican food and I've been in Vegas for a year and never found good Mexican food until this place popped up across the street from my house. The taco combo is excellent and so is the carne asada wet burrito, this place is a must try & they deliver.
I tend to usually try different taco joints let me tell you this is one of the best one I tried. It's in my top ten list of taco shops.
Carne Asada Chimichanga  excellent. Flavor on point, polite service and seasoned well. Will be back.

My new ADDICTION. I've gained a GOOD TEN POUNDS in two weeks since eating their food. My husband and I are IN LOVE with their al pastor tacos and carne asada burritos. Their churros are great too! Their customer service is as good as their food. They're definitely a must try.
Best breakfast burrito I ever had. If it had a little more cheese I would have swore I had died and gone to heaven.

If I could give this place 10 stars, I would!! The customer service is outstanding, the cleanliness is spot on and the food. The food is absolutely delicious!!! I'm from Texas and have had a hard time finding good Mexican food, and I have finally found my spot!! This is my second time in within 5 days. The chimichanga is ohhhhhh sooooo  gooooddddd!!!!! And homemade tortilla chips and salsa. Just eat here.
Got to try it.  Great little business where the owners put there hart into every dish.  Can't wait to come again.

Tried it the first time today and the food is so good. I had 3 street style tacos with carne asada, marinated chicken and carnitas. Definitely will come back again to try the other things on the menu.

Daniel gives Grade A customer service. An excellent speaker and presenter. Really, for me, a restaurant can give great quality food, but if their service is just average, or lacking, it can keep it from earning that extra star. And from the moment we walked in, to the moment we left, Daniel provided us with that 5 star customer service.

One thing I really like, is that they are willing to make food custom-made, the way you want it. So you can order a burrito with a fried egg in the middle, if you wanted.

We ordered, the Steak Street Style Tacos, the Carne Asada Chimichangas and Carne Asada Fries. Side note: all the ingredients used here are fresh and made in house. They don't get the ingredients out of a jar. They even make their salsas in-house too. I recommend trying their Scorpion Pepper Salsa. I tried their Diablo Salsa and it was not too spicy, so if you want the spiciest they have, Scorpion is the way to go.

From the ingredients, to the way they craft their food- because they don't just slap some stuff together and call it a day- No, they craft their delicacies here, to the presentation of the food, I can see everyone who walks through the gates, into this establishment, becoming a loyal customer.

The Chimichangas here are well-balanced and full. It just looks like it would be delicious and it was. I could not stop eating it. The cheese, oh my gosh, the cheese was grand! The carne, it was just great. Definitely, get the chimichangas, when you visit.

The street tacos, are very close to the ones from San Diego, near Tijuana. I know, I'm from there.

The Carne Asada fries. What I really liked about the Carne Asada Fries, were the fries. Usually the fries are too hard, or too soggy, the fries here were just right. Soft enough to bite into and still has a nice crunch to it.

A generous amount of food for a small price of 31.

Also, if you're a local, they deliver, no charge. That's how you buy customer loyalty.
High quality food, great customer service, without a doubt one of the best mexican restaurants in town. I would highly recommend the chimmichanga as well as the tacos and nachos! Thanks Daniel!
Great customer service and authentic Mexican food. They were very accomodating and friendly to us. Thank you, we'll be back!

I have so many things about this taco shop to say!!

I want to start off by saying it's in a small strip mall on the corner of Tenaya and Alexander next to a small DQ and gas station. 

When you enter its small, carefully decorated, clean and very well kept up. The bathroom, only one is super clean!  

The staff, wow they were so nice and attentive. I haven't ever felt so welcomed in a restaurant around Las Vegas,  as I was while we were there!! 

The food, holy molly the food was amazing. The tacos from crunchy to street were flavorful and delicious!! The beans and rice were spot on in flavors, fresh and yummy!! 

The chips and salsa were my favorite. We got to try three salsas and a queso. Which were all amazing and if you're looking for a great queso get it here, it's fantastic!!!

They have fountain drinks and Mexican bottled coke!!! 

I can't imagine ever going wrong here if you're looking for good taco in the North West area!!!
It is a hidden treasure! Quick yummy affordable food! Friendly staff and delicious food!

The yelp app said a new taco joint is near you. I love tacos so I went for lunch. Holy crap $2.25 for a chicken taco. Hmmm. I said to myself that it will be better than the other places so I ordered one. I also ordered a bean tostada. Holy crap. $5.49 for that. I ordered to go. 
When I got home the taco was a 2inch soft taco. The taco truck down the street only charges $1. The tostada was no bigger than the 99cent store shells that you buy. It was soggy and it had beans all over the bottom. Del Taco charges $1 for the same thing. I also wanted a taco salad. I asked the asian man taking my order if they had a salad. It was not on the menu. He said that he could make one for me. $8.49. It was awful. I ordered it with grilled chicken. There was about 3 small pieces. Horrible. Plus I tipped them. 
I will never go back to this overpriced place again. 
Just go to Taco Bell or Del Taco. Same food. Lower price.
Had the combination plate 3 tacos rice and beans. The tacos were good but the rice and beans were pretty bland. Probably will try again but not get this meal.
Just had the al pastor chimichanga was great. Good food and close to home i will for sure be returning.

Frustrating experience. Got two asada tacos to go with a side of creama and they forgot the creama had to get out of my car go back in then went to eat and put no silverware in the bag or napkins after I asked if they were in there. The salsa with chips taste like enchilada sauce. The rice take microwaved and beans tasted like nothing. The only thing that was good was the meat was tender that was it
1st time having this place and i was impressed. Good street tacos and rice and beans. I will come back.

Their food is amazing! The service here was perfect, the guy was extremely nice and when I asked if they had a habanero salsa he brought out two more salsas! We had four salsas and ordered a side of guacamole and it was so tasty and fresh! I ordered a carnitas taco and a carne asada taco and they were both yummy, I think I'll go with all carne asada next time just because I was more a fan of that one! My husband got the wet fajita burrito and it was awesome as well! We'll definitely be back :)

The owner has little to no customer service skills.. He is never friendly -- and the food is mediocre at best.. We tried multiple times to give this place a shot -- simply because it was within our neighborhood.. 

I'd rather drive to Robertos and support their warm friendly staff - before giving these guys any more business..
Great customer service! Downtown feel, neighborhood prices! We will definitely return!

Best mexican food in Las Vegas. I've had a hell of a time finding a good mexican food place in vegas. Most are just okay. It's the one thing I miss about California. But I've been very happy that I've found this place. You won't be disappointed with this place.

Tacos de Asada are really good tender juicy and the meat actually has flavor. And the carne asada fries also not your average fries these are crunchy and amazing will be back for my next taco fix for sure better then the well known taco spots out there. Hole in the wall spots always win!!!

Decided to try this place out and I'm glad I did. From the moment you walk in the owner is very nice and makes you feel welcome. Got the carne asada street tacos and they are quite possibly the best tacos I have ever had. Def worth trying out.

Very clean, friendly staff, and good food! I ordered 8 taco asada($2.25 each), lots of meat which was good but not enough onions, cilantro and did not have guacamole. Otherwise, it is spicy which I loved! My husband said it was too spicy.

I had the Carne Asada burrito. They normally put rice and beans in the burrito which I don't like so I passed on those which ended up making my burrito a little on the smaller side and lacking the quantity of meat I get at other places.  The flavor of the burrito was good though.  I tried the chips and salsa.  I like thin chips and they serve the thick type so if your into that you would like them.  I prefer a salsa that I enjoy eating a fair amount of but their salsa is more like hot sauce where a little goes a long way and is more like something you would add on top a burrito or taco than eat with chips. The standout was the service.  The gentleman that runs the place is fantastic and very caring and is probably the best service I have ever experienced at this type of restaurant.  He aimed to please.

This place is a great taco shop!  Authentic tasting food that is put together with every attempt to satisfy.  My family and I went here tonight, which is always interesting due to food allergies.  My wife is allergic to Dairy and my daughter to Peanuts.  The very well spoken chef went through each ingredient thoroughly.  We have found our new favorite place!  Thank you for a great meal!  Definitely recommend!

Owner takes great pride in their work and it shows. I had the fajitas and they were fantastic! Although the soft drinks come in whimsical glass jars, you get free refills. Staff also provides table side service; which I appreciate. Sum it up, awesome food, courteous service, and fun atmosphere! I highly recommend it for anyone looking to get a quick bite!
